Legal Practice:: American Bar Association; American College of Trial Lawyers; Champaign County Bar Association; Illinois State Bar Association United States Tax Court 400 Second Street, NW, Washington, DC 20217 Tel: (202) 521-0700 Internet: www.ustaxcourt.gov Number of Judgeships: 19 The United States Tax Court hears disputes involving the Internal Revenue Service and deficiencies or overpayment of taxes. The United States Tax Court judges are appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate to 15-year terms. A chief judge is elected biennially by fellow judges. Both recalled and special trial judges serve at the pleasure of the court. Public trials are conducted by a single judge or a special trial judge. These rulings can be appealed to the United States Courts of Appeals and the Supreme Court of the United States. FEDERAL COURTS— UNITED STATES COURTS OF LIMITED JURISDICTION
